intro: Ludekia, commonly known as the mountain snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Alps and Carpathian Mountains. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine meadows, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Ludekia has small, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along its stem. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant among gardeners who cultivate alpine and rock gardens.
